item.title: Litter and rubbish along the alleyway, 3rd July
item.description:
Ongoing issue with fly tipping in the alleyway. Please pick up litter along the whole alleyway not just the rubbish seen towards the riverdale road side. Litter is also along alleyway towards the Holly Hill road side of the alleyway. we have been seeing mice!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Riverdale Road, Northumberland Heath, London

item.title: So dam dangerous, 3rd July
item.description:
Please fix this god awful trip hazard. The new development has ruined the pavement. Has a 5 inch drop now. So dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 221, West End Lane, West Hampstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Temporary traffic lights not working, 3rd July
item.description:
The temporary traffic lights at the junction of Downsbridge Road and Scotts Lane where there is also a mini roundabout are not working. This appears to be creating problems and congestion for drivers at the mini-roundabout as there are also bollards in the road which are narrowing the lanes. Please could someone either enforce Thames Water to come and complete their work or switch on the traffic lights for everyone's safety. As a nearby resident I am also unhappy to hear car horns being blasted frequently due to drivers becoming frustrated with the traffic congestion - this would be appeased by the temporary traffic lights working as they should
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downsbridge Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Utility Works and Temporary Traffic Lights

item.title: Dog poo bin not emptied for many days at bottom of Eastney Street, 3rd July
item.description:
The problem is with the dog poo bin next to the green Thames river gate on the Thames Path at the bottom of Eastney Street where it joins Crane Street and Highbridge Wharf. It hasn't been emptied for many days - we think two weeks - and it is overflowing with dog waste and walkers are just dumping it on the floor. It is very unhygenic, especially in this hot weather and as so many young children use the path. Please could it be emptied and cleaned asap. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Crane Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Builder using parking spaces/road instead of skip, 3rd July
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 20, Nutbrook Street, London
